explanation: Agent A's reasoning is correct. MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.2 forbids code that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour. If, in the project configuration, the mhd_assert macro is defined as ((void)0), each mhd_assert(...) in queue_auth_required_response3_inner becomes a no-op expression statement. Those no-op statements are executed but have no effect, and removing them would not change program behaviour — they therefore meet the definition of dead code and violate Rule 2.2 in that build configuration. (Minor note: the scenario text mentions mhd_assert(da->algo_selected) specifically although that exact call does not appear in the supplied function; the function does contain multiple mhd_assert(...) uses which are affected the same way.)
